intro: Leucostele bolligeriana, commonly known as the Bolliger's leucostele, is a rare and specialized member of the Balanophoraceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature. It is a hemiparasitic plant that relies on the roots of other plants for nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis. The plant has a unique stem structure with a central vascular bundle, typical of the leucostele group. Its leaves are small and often clustered at the base, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
